intro: Craspedia basaltica, commonly known as the basalt daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in coastal dunes or on basaltic substrates. Craspedia basaltica is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
